item.title: CPU Overclocking
item.description: Stress Tests # prime95 # Run application at small FFT AVX2 torture test for 1-2 hours to achieve maximum stability. If you’re not bothered about being as stable as possible but just want very strong stability, run application at small FFT without AVX torture test for 1-2 hours.

item.title: Fans
item.description: Table of Contents # Information Static Pressure Bearings Non-RGB Fans 120mm 140mm 40mm 80-92mm 180mm RGB Fans 120mm RGB 140mm RGB Information # Static Pressure # Static pressure is the amount of pressure exerted in the direction of the fan is pushing the air, which will help it with cooling in situations with restrictive airflow, such as radiators. This will make fans that are optimised for static pressure perform better on radiators compared to ones that aren’t.

item.title: Memory
item.description: Table of Contents # Basics ICs DDR5 ICs DDR4 ICs Architecture Specific Overclocking Alderlake DDR4 Overclocking Zen2 DDR4 Overclocking Zen DDR4 Overclocking Lantency In-Depth tRAS tRC First Word Latency Basics # Understanding Frequency and Timings # DDR4 Memory Gear-Down Mode Explained # ICs # DDR5 ICs # DDR5 IC Tier List # Tier ICs Description S Hynix A-Die Best DDR5 IC known (however, worse than M-Die on Zen4). A Hynix M-Die High performing IC, can still be overclocked very far.

item.title: Memory Overclocking
item.description: Guides: # MemTestHelper DDR4 OC Guide # Stress Tests # y-cruncher # Run application and select “Component Stress Tester”. Disable all tests but N32, N64, VST - Then select “Start stress testing”. Run for 4 iterations. This is good at picking out errors that the main stress test may not., especially on Alderlake CPUs. TestMem5 # This is the best option for stressing DDR4 memory. Run and load the anta777 Extreme1 config, and make sure the application is running as admin for stressing memory.
